response.original_title: Daughters of Anatolia: Portrait of a Nomadic Goat Herding Family
response.overview: Daughters of Anatolia follows the Gök family, a group of nomadic goat herders, as they travel on the “Göҫ,” or seasonal migration, from the temperate winters along the Mediterranean Sea to the cool summers in the Taurus Mountains, and back again. It is a route their ancestors pursued for a thousand years in order to provide forage for the animals throughout the year. The family relies on their 350 goats for their sustenance and livelihood.
response.title: Daughters of Anatolia: Portrait of a Nomadic Goat Herding Family
